meanings.definition: A place where containers are stored or transferred between different modes of transportation.
meanings.sent1: The containerports were bustling with activity as trucks unloaded cargo.
meanings.sent2: Ships docked at the containerports to load and unload containers.
meanings.sent3: The containerports were so busy that even the seagulls had to wait in line.
meanings.sent4: The containerports were like giant puzzle pieces fitting perfectly into the logistics network.
meanings.sent5: The containerports stood like giants, connecting land and sea seamlessly.

meanings.definition: The facilities and infrastructure used for handling containers at a port.
meanings.sent1: Workers at the containerports efficiently moved containers onto waiting ships.
meanings.sent2: The containerports invested in new cranes to improve container handling.
meanings.sent3: The containerports had a surprise visitor when a seal decided to sunbathe on a container.
meanings.sent4: The containerports hummed with activity, like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The containerports were the heart of the port, ensuring smooth cargo operations.

meanings.definition: The ports equipped to handle containerized cargo.
meanings.sent1: The containerports were essential for the efficient transfer of goods.
meanings.sent2: Modern containerports have advanced security systems to protect cargo.
meanings.sent3: The containerports were so efficient that even the crabs wanted to help out.
meanings.sent4: The containerports were like gateways to the global economy.
meanings.sent5: The containerports sparkled in the sunlight, a beacon for trade and commerce.
